alert.note: Alert for Modoc (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 14 at 4:59PM PDT until March 16 at 4:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Medford OR has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in California... Pit River near Canby affecting Modoc County. For the Pit River...including Canby...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON TO THURSDAY AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD WATCH... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pit River near Canby. * WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon to Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Expect moderate flooding in Canby and Lookout in Modoc County and Beiber and Nubeiber in Lassen County 4300 cfs * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM PDT Tuesday the stage was 6.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 8.7 feet tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 8.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.8 feet on 04/05/1955. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 500 AM PDT.
